subject: Make the Individual tests linkable for meson
commitMessage:
Make the Individual tests linkable for meson

- In the current state, the tests can only be linkable
  together into a single binary, as we are using the few
  vaiables from external tests and using them during link
  time to generate the executable.

- The idea of this commit is to make the unit test files
  linkable individually, so that we have have a better way
  of running unitests through meson, rather than bundling all
  the tests into a gaigantic binary.

TestedBy:
The unit tests are passed in CI

Signed-off-by: Manojkiran Eda <manojkiran.eda@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I67b953e5bc227d876139373aebeacbf5c20f56ef

Can you explain more on how the problem is solved now by moving the definition of the global function in the global object.cpp

Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 11:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Can you explain more on how the problem is solved now by moving the definition of the global function in the global object.cpp

Ratan,

Without this fix, as the objects are declared extern , it would be only possible to link all of test_cpp files together as they have dependency among themselves at compile time.

By separating out the extern variables into an its own object,we are eliminating the compile time dependency across the test_cpp files. And in meson we can declare this cpp file as a dependency for all the test files, as shown below so that we can compile each test into its own binary & can run them in one step via "ninja test":

#########################################################################
# declare dependency tests

syscalllib = declare_dependency(sources: ['mock_syscall.cpp','global_objects.cpp'], 
                                dependencies : deps)

##################################################################################
# declare the test sources

test_list = [
  'test_util.cpp',
  'test_netlink.cpp',
  'test_network_manager.cpp',
  'test_config_parser.cpp',
  'test_rtnetlink.cpp',
  'test_neighbor.cpp',
  'test_ethernet_interface.cpp',
  'test_vlan_interface.cpp'
]

# Run the tests

foreach tests:test_list
  test_name = tests.split('.')[0]
  test(test_name,
       executable(test_name,tests,
                 include_directories : ['.','../'],
                 link_with : libnetworkd,
                 link_args: dynamic_linker,
                 build_rpath: get_option('oe-sdk').enabled() ? rpath : '',
                 dependencies : [ gtest,
                                  gmock,
                                  syscalllib,
                                  thread_dep,
                                  dl_dep,
                                ] + deps), timeout:40)
endforeach

please add the tested by:

The unit tests are passed in CI. I am not changing any of the src code, but just made the extern objects that are present in test files into a different object file, so that we can compile individual test files seperately rather than together.
can't we define these functions as MockManager class members?

No, I don't think so. These two functions are actually coming from network_manager_main.cpp and are not included in the header file and are also not included as a part of manager class as well. And by definition Mock manager is a mock class for manager so thats, not the ideal place to put these functions.

There are certain tests like rtnetlink that need these functions to be inside the phosphor::network namespace and not inside a mockmanager object.
Can we have global object.hpp where we can declare these functions and it will be defined by both the application (network_manager as well as the mock manager)?

I can do this was well, but william had suggested me to create a separate object for these in the earlier comments.

What do you suggest ? I don't have any strict preference on this as long as all the tests are compiling fine.
